1.500 gms minced mutton

 2.1/2 tsp coriander seeds

 3.1 stick cinnamon

 4.1 tsp black pepper

 5.1 tsp cumin

 6.3 cloves

 7.1 cup refined oil

 8.1 onion, finely chopped

 9.15 garlic cloves

 10.1 medium knob, chopped ginger

 11.4 green chillies

 12.Salt to taste

 13.1/2 tsp turmeric powder

 14.1/2 tsp chilli powder

 15.500 ml water

 16.2 boiled potatoes

 17.A small bunch of fresh coriander

 18.1/2 lime

1.In a pan, dry roast coriander seeds, cinnamon, black pepper, cumin and cloves.
 Pound them together with a mortar and pestle.
 Transfer this garam masala into a small cup.


 2.Saute one finely chopped onion and refined oil in a pan.


 3.Pound garlic, ginger, green chilies and salt in a mortar and pestle.
 Add them into a pan and saute them together


 4.Add powder spices like turmeric powder, chili powder and salt into a pan and saute them all together.


 5.Add water into a pan and mix them well


 6.Add mutton mince, garam masala and salt into a pan and saute them together


 7.Transfer the mix into a bowl and add 2 smashed potatoes, green chillies, fresh coriander and half lime.


 8.Mix them well together and for binding use flour and bread crumbs


 9.Shape them into cutlets


 10.Pick three wide plates for cutlet binders.
 In the first plate, break open two eggs and mix them well.
 In the second plate, add half a cup of flour and in third plate, add seasoned bread crumbs and mix them well


 11.Coat the cutlets with flour, dip them in the egg and than coat them with the seasoned bread crumbs


 12.Keep them in a fridge for 20 minutes.


 13.Shallow fry the cutlets in refined oil.


 14.Garnish and serve hot.
